result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of 20.00 plus costs and assessments of this action.
-Comply with all conditions of probation in file 21CF171, 20CF504, and 20CF197. Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition.
-Defendant must graduate from the Douglas County Treatment Court Program. 
-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant.

-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the parties agree that there will be a joint recommendation for a sentence of 2 years imprisonment, fashioned as 1 year of initial confinement and 1 year of extended supervision along with $20 fine plus costs, fees, and assessments. The parties agree that this two year sentence will be consecutive to 21CF171, 20CF504 and 20CF197 if this agreement is revoked, judgment is entered and the sentence is imposed. 
-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c).
-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to amend this count to a violation of 961.41(3g)(d), possession of amphetamine, an unclassified misdemeanor, with a recommended sentence of $20 fine plus felony costs and assessments.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Reynolds Cadreau

defendant.name: Cadreau, Justin Reynolds
defendant.address: 2280 E Birch Tr, Twn Of Superior, WI 54880

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Stipulation and Order Permitting Modification of Bond

8:32 AM Defendant Justin Reynolds Cadreau in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Justin Reynolds Cadreau.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will enter into a plea, asking for DJOC. Defendant accepted into treatment court. Attorney Nelson agrees. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the agreement. DA will monitor.

9:10 AM Defendant Justin Reynolds Cadreau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Justin Reynolds Cadreau.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates offer and discussions. Asks for status. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:44 AM BAIL/BOND HEARING/ARRAIGNMENT. Defendant Justin Reynolds Cadreau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Justin Reynolds Cadreau.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Nelson indicates doesn't have tons of information, other than defendant's mother had passed away. Defendant is hoping to be released to address the matter. Would like reduced to signature bond. Or grant of a furlough for a few days.  State is opposed to reduction or furlough. Defendant is on a DOC hold and will not be released anyway. Has a history of 11 prior criminal convictions, on probation for at least 2 other cases. Cites FTA's on prior signature bonds. For those reasons doesn't feel reduction is warranted.
Attorney Nelson indicates defendant is a local resident.
Court believes cash bail as previously set is appropriate and would still be held on a probation hold regardless. Not opposed to a furlough if that can be arranged with appropriate parties. Motion for bail modification is denied. 

Nelson asks to do arraignment today.  Nelson receives complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's notice of motion and motion for reduction of bail
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:50 PM Defendant Justin Reynolds Cadreau appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Craker.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Attorney Kruger.
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. Defendant's address confirmed. 
State requests 1500cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Defendant likely on probation hold, most recent 2021 omvoc. reviews crim history, ftas x 4, on probation for 3 files.  has mn hist. number of cases in short period of time.  committed crimes while on probation on multiple files.
Attorney indicates on probation hold, notes co defendants and conflict.  strong community ties, no violent convictions, does not believe high amount of cash nec. no ability to post. 
Court reviews argument and concerns. ORDERS 1500cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
